title: An organ-chip model of sporadic ALS using iPSC-derived spinal cord motor neurons and an integrated blood-brain-like barrier

abstract: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is a fatal neurodegenerative disorder in which motor neurons (MNs) of the brain and spinal cord degenerate, leading to paralysis. Generating MNs from patient-specific induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) may …
